column1:
How do I create a new Album and upload my Photos?|

To create an Album
column2:
please follow the steps below:
1. Click on “Albums” from the main navigation menu bar at the top of any page on this community.
2. Select “Add New Photos”.
3. Fill the basic details for your Album and click on “Add Photos” to select one or more photos from your computer. To select multiple photos at once
column3:
hold down the Control Key (Ctrl) on your computer.
4. When your upload is finished
column4:
click the “Save Photos” button below your photo list to save them to your album.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
How do I add new photos to an already existing album?|

To add new photos to an already existing album:
 1. Click on “Albums” from the main navigation menu bar at the top of any page on this community.
 2. Select “Add New Photos”.
 3. Choose an Album for which you want to add new photos from the dropdown in the field “Choose Album”.
 4. Click on “Add Photos” to select one or more photos from your hard-drive. To select multiple photos at once
column2:
hold down the Control Key (Ctrl) on your keyboard.
 5. When your upload is finished
column3:
click the “Save Photos” button below your photo list to save them to your Album.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
How can I upload or edit my Profile Picture?|

To upload a Profile Photo or edit current Profile Photo:
1. Click on “Edit My Profile” from the quick links on your “Homepage” or your “Profile Page”.
2. Select “Edit My Photo”.
3. Click on “Browse” button and select a photo from your hard-drive.
4. Now
column2:
click on “Save Photo” to save your Profile Picture or “remove photo” to remove it.
5. Use “Edit Thumbnail” to edit the thumbnail of your Profile Picture.

Tip: You can also make any Photo your Profile Photo by simply going to any Photo and clicking on “Make Profile Photo” option available at the bottom of the Photo.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
Who all can see my Album?|

You can choose who all can see your Album while creating your Album
column2:
by choosing the appropriate option for the “Privacy” field. You can edit this privacy any time by clicking on the “Edit Settings” link for your Album.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
Who all can comment on my Album?|

You can choose who all can comment on your Album while creating your Album
column2:
by choosing the appropriate option for the “Comment Privacy” field. You can edit this privacy any time by clicking on the “Edit Settings” link for your Album.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
Who may tag Photos in my Album?|

You can choose who all can tag Photos in your Album while creating your Album
column2:
by choosing the appropriate option for the “Tagging” field. You can edit this privacy any time by clicking on the “Edit Settings” link for your Album.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
How can I tag my friends in photos?|

To tag your friends
column2:
please follow the steps below:
1. Go to the photo and open it.
2. Click on “Tag This Photo”.
3. Start typing the name of your friend and select it from the auto-suggest dropdown.
4. Now

column1:
I have been tagged in a photo. How can I delete my tag from the photo?|

To delete your tag from a photo
column3:
placed next to your name (linked to your profile).

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
I have tagged someone in a photo. How can I delete that tag from the photo?|

To delete a tag that you have made in a photo
column3:
placed next to that tagged name.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
There is a "Wall Photos" album in my albums. What is this album?|

When you post a photo with an update post for the first time from your activity feed
column2: a special album: "Wall Photos" is created automatically for you. Then onwards
column3:
photos from the update posts made by you from the status update box are added to this album.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
What kind of photos are acceptable on this site (and what are not)?|

You can upload pretty much anything that is legal
column2: decent and honest. We do not allow nudity of any kind and sexually explicit photos are also banned.  Users who break rules will get a warning and persistent offenders will have their membership terminated

column1:
I have uploaded a new profile photo but I can only see the old one.|

This is a caching problem. Instead of being made up of static web pages that don't change very often
column2: our pages are actually created on the fly
column3:
every time they are requested.  The data they contain is constantly changing too.
It's most likely that your web browser is displaying web pages from the cache on your computer which is why you are seeing old information. Clearing the cache of your web browser and refreshing the page will solve your problem.  
If your Browser is Internet Explorer
column4: you'll find the settings for this in the “Tools” drop-down menu. In Firefox
column5: you will find the settings for this in the “Tools” > “Clear Recent History” menu. In Chrome
column6:
you will find the settings for this in the “Tools” > “History” menu.

|Popular Features|Photos

column1:
My problem is not listed above. What should I do now?|

If your problem is not listed above
column2:
then please contact us by filling the “Contact Us” form using the “Contact” link available in the footer of our site. Let us know your problem and we will try to fix it as soon as possible.

|Popular Features|Photos
